ranked_diseases.explanation: Hypertelorism and orofacial cleft are common findings in this condition. Sleep abnormality may be associated due to neurological defects.
Characterized by orofacial clefts and may sometimes present with hypertelorism. Sleep abnormalities are less characteristic but possible due to craniofacial anomalies.
Hypertelorism is a key feature of Noonan syndrome, which sometimes also features orofacial clefts. Sleep abnormalities can arise due to airway obstruction.
Features include hypertelorism and cleft lip/palate. Sleep issues might stem from airway anomalies related to craniofacial features.
